metadata.title: CVE-2023-6866 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
TypedArrays can be fallible and lacked proper exception handling. Thiscould lead to abuse in other APIs which expect TypedArrays to alwayssucceed. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 121.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-6866` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 121.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 121.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 121.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '121.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
